definition: to draw out/to pull out from in between/to remove part of the whole/(of certain plants) to sprout or bud/to whip or thrash

sentences.english: His mouth continued to twitch unspeaking in nervous curls of disdain.
sentences.chinese: 嘴唇却一个劲儿地抽搐着，显示出神经质的嘲讽。

sentences.english: I get twitches and shakes out of nowhere, I always lose my line of thought.
sentences.chinese: 我会平白无故地抽搐，总是忘记自己想说什么。

sentences.english: The creature fell onto its side, had a fit and died.
sentences.chinese: 那只羊侧身倒了下去，抽搐了一下就死了。
雷尔夫感到他的嘴唇在抽搐。

sentences.english: In severe cases, may have irritability, convulsions coma.
sentences.chinese: 重者可有躁动，抽搐式昏迷。

sentences.english: Methods:47 patients divided into convulsive group and non-convulsive group.
sentences.chinese: 将47例病人分为伴抽搐组和非抽搐组。

sentences.english: Methods:47 patients divided into convulsive group and non-convulsive group.
sentences.chinese: 将47例病人分为伴抽搐组和非抽搐组。

sentences.english: His hand and shoulder were twitching from the unlooked-for contact.
sentences.chinese: 由于这不期而遇的相逢，他的手和肩部在抽搐。

sentences.english: Do you keep your bed partner awake with the jerking movements of your legs?
sentences.chinese: 你是否因为你脚的抽搐导致同床共枕之人无法安眠？

sentences.english: Linnea still wages the battle against her stuttering and tics each and every day.
sentences.chinese: 琳内娅每天仍然要和她的口吃和抽搐战斗。

sentences.english: A nervous tic that had gotten out of control.
sentences.chinese: 一种失去控制的神经性抽搐。

sentences.english: The red-faced, merry soldier was still twitching convulsively ; but they did not carry him away.
sentences.chinese: 那个红脸的士兵还在抽搐，但没有人来抬他。

sentences.english: At once I noticed that field marshal's face continuously twitches.
sentences.chinese: 我立刻就注意到，这位陆军元帅的脸在不断抽搐。

sentences.english: A day into the burial of the former scientists, a body began to twitch.
sentences.chinese: 据一项前科学家埋葬一天，身体开始抽搐。

sentences.english: The patient lost consciousness and went into convulsions.

definition: to twitch/to throb/a spasm/to extract and use
to throb with pain/throbbing pain/twang/pang/CL:陣|阵[zhen4]
to tremble/to shiver/uncontrolled shaking of the body
